text: hey guys it's Elise and welcome back to
my cupcake addiction today I'm going to
be showing you how to do a really cool
and really simple melted a chocolate bar
illusion on kind of a classic looking
birthday cake let's get started to make
your cake I'm using a double batch of my
perfectly pipeable buttercream frosting
and I've tinted mine pink and flavored
it with strawberry you can use any color
or flavor you like I've also got some
sponge cakes so I've got 4 1 inch high
by 7 inch round sponge cakes we're gonna
make quite a tall cake today I've got a
plastic ruler and offset spatula and a
serrated edge knife I've got some
compound chocolate so this is chocolate
that doesn't contain cocoa butter I've
also got some Hershey's bars you could
do something like lint here but make
sure it's a nice thin chocolate bar
because you don't want them to be too
large or they're going to be too heavy
to stand up on top of the cake I've got
some sprinkles I'm using some little
round confetti sequins some whipping
cream with a 35 percent milk fat a
couple ziplock bags and a pair of
scissors I also have a little bit of
baking paper and a cake board and you'll
need some kind of a tray just to set
your chocolate bar on so the first thing
you want to do here is you want to get
all of your cakes level and about the
same height so pick your shortest or
your smallest layer and you just want to
trim the top off so that it's nice and
flat and level then you want to use that
as your guide for all of your other
layers so that they're all about the
same width and about the same thickness
you can use a cake leveler here or you
can just do it by eye using your offset
spatula just smear down a bit of
buttercream and that's kind of going to
glue your bottom layer to the board so
your cake doesn't move around and then
you want to put down another layer of
frosting making sure that it protrudes
over the edges of your layer of sponge
all goes our next layer of sponge and a
little bit more buttercream frosting and
to have layered all four of your layers
of cake you want to take some of that
buttercream frosting now we're going to
do a crumb coat so really smear it sort
of into those grooves between the cake
layers and make sure that you're working
the spatula back and forward to get that
frosting right into any cracks creases
and crevasses on your cake put a little
bit on top you should have a fair amount
of frosting here so now you want to
scrape it back
so what you've got is a really thin
crumb coat you can see cake coming
through it that's totally fine once
you've got that relatively smooth and
all scraped back pop it off into the
freezer for 15 minutes and we're gonna
let the crumb coat set melt down your
compound chocolate or your chocolate
melts and I've put my Hershey's onto a
baking tray lined with that baking paper
and then I'm just using the chocolate to
kind of get right up nice and close to
the edges what you want to make here is
like a long chocolate stick almost this
is going to go inside the cake it's
completely edible but it's going to give
stability to your chocolate bar break up
your remaining Hershey's chocolate and
then pour over your whipping cream and
I'm going to pop this into the microwave
for 30 second intervals stirring in
between it should only take about a
minute your quantities for what is
essentially a small batch of chocolate
ganache I'm going to leave in the
description box below this video as you
stir it you'll see that chocolate
dissolves and you can see the thickness
so you don't want it to be too thin here
around this consistency is perfect take
your cake out of the freezer and it
should be nice and firm and solid and
then you're going to put your nice
pretty coat on top and the ideas with
that crumb coat you should end up with
no crumbs in the top layer of your
frosting so put a really generous amount
of that strawberry buttercream on all
over the sides and all over the top and
then using your ruler use that to scrape
back the edges what you'll get is a
really nice smooth side and then kind of
like a cement layer you just want to use
the ruler to come across the top and
just neaten off those edges near enough
is good enough here because you're going
to sort of edge the bottom using those
confetti sprinkles or any sprinkles you
like by just pressing them up against
the side of the cake give your cake
board a little bit of a tidy up and then
you want to pop it back in the fridge or
the freezer for about 10 minutes just to
start to crust on top so that it's not
soft soft buttercream make sure here
that you can - is at room temperature
you don't want this to be hot or it's
going to melt through the buttercream so
it's sort of a bit of a fine line in
making sure that it's still melted and
it hasn't started to get completely cold
but it's not still at all hot I put
about three or four tablespoons on top
of my cake and then just use the offset
spatula to really just gently smooth it
evenly over the top so that it just
starts to dribble over the edges kinda
like melting chocolate give it a couple
of good high
taps on the bench and that'll sort of
force those chocolate drizzles down the
side a little bit and then you can pull
your Hershey's bar out of the fridge
stick it up next to the cake so you can
get a rough idea of how tall your cake
has ended up I had to snap off about an
inch or so from the bottom of mine and
then you can just take your chocolate
stick essentially and shove that
chocolate bar right down to the center
of the cake you want to apply an even
pressure here because you definitely
don't want to break your chocolate bar
at this point a little bit of the rest
of that chocolate ganache goes into a
ziploc bag and then you can snip off
just a very small corner of the ziploc
bag sort of making like a makeshift
piping bag and then you're just going to
come up and around the join where the
chocolate bar meets the cake so that
you've got ganache acting like losing
melting this and the ganache on the
chocolate bar matches the ganache on the
top of a cake that is it that is a
relatively simple to make but really
really cool to look at birthday cake you
